class pyqed.namd.diabatic.SPO(x, nstates, psi0=None, mass=1, v=None)

Bases: object

k_evolve(dt, k, psi_x)

one time step for exp(-i * K * dt)

run(dt, psi0, nt=1)

Perform a series of time-steps via the time-dependent Schrodinger Equation.

Parameters:

  • dt (float) – the small time interval over which to integrate

  • Nsteps (float, optional) – the number of intervals to compute. The total change in time at the end of this method will be dt * Nsteps. default is N = 1

x_evolve(psi, vpsi)

vpsi = exp(-i V dt)

class pyqed.namd.diabatic.SPO2(x, y, mass, nstates=2, coords='linear', G=None, abc=False)

Bases: object

second-order split-operator method for nonadiabatic wavepacket dynamics in the diabatic representation with two-dimensional nuclear coordinate

For time-independent Hamiltonian

e^{-i H Delta t} = e^{- i V Delta t/2} e^{-i K Delta t} e^{-iVDelta t/2}

For time-dependent H,

TBI

build(dt, inertia=None)

Setup the propagators appearing in the split-operator method.

For the kinetic energy operator with Jacobi coordinates

K =

rac{p_r^2}{2mu} + rac{1}{I(r)} p_ heta^2

Since the two KEOs for each dof do not commute, it has to be factorized as

e^{-i K delta t} = e{-i K_1 delta t} e^{- i K_2 delta t}

where $p_ heta = -i pa_ heta$ is the momentum operator.

dtTYPE

DESCRIPTION.

intertia: func

moment of inertia, only used for Jocabi coordinates.

None.

class pyqed.namd.diabatic.SPO3(x, y, z, mass, nstates=2, coords='linear', G=None, abc=False)

second-order split-operator method for nonadiabatic wavepacket dynamics in the diabatic representation with three-dimensional nuclear space

For time-independent Hamiltonian

\[e^{-i H \Delta t} = e^{- i V \Delta t/2} e^{-i K \Delta t} e^{-iV\Delta t/2}\]
For time-dependent H,

build(dt, inertia=None)

Setup the propagators appearing in the split-operator method.

For the kinetic energy operator with Jacobi coordinates

K =

rac{p_r^2}{2mu} + rac{1}{I(r)} p_ heta^2

Since the two KEOs for each dof do not commute, it has to be factorized as

e^{-i K delta t} = e{-i K_1 delta t} e^{- i K_2 delta t}

where $p_ heta = -i pa_ heta$ is the momentum operator.

class pyqed.namd.ldr.GWP2(basis, mol=None, nstates=2, ndim=2)

Bases: WPD2

2-dimensional nonadiabatic wavepacket dynamics (NAWPD) with locally diabatic representation

This method requires adiabatic electronic states at DVR grids, obtained by diagonalizing the x matrix.

nuclear_density(psi, x, y)

compute the nuclear density .. math:

ho(f R, t) = sum_{n,m} sum_{eta, lpha} C_{meta}^* A_{meta, nlpha} C_{nlpha} chi_n(f R) chi^*_m(f R)

xTYPE, optional

DESCRIPTION. The default is None.

yTYPE, optional

DESCRIPTION. The default is None.

class pyqed.namd.ldr.NAWPD(basis, mol=None, nstates=2, ndim=1)

Bases: WPD

multi-dimensional nonadiabatic wavepacket dynamics (NAWPD) with locally diabatic representation

This method requires adiabatic electronic states at DVR grids, obtained by diagonalizing the x matrix.

buildH()

The potential energy operator is straightforward as it only requires the adiabatic PES.

The T_N construction requires the electronic overlap .. math:

T_{m eta, nlpha} = K_{mn} raket{eta(R_m)| lpha(R_n)}
buildK(dtype=<class 'float'>)
buildV(v=None)

v (TYPE, size nb, nstates) – DESCRIPTION. The default is None.
